intro: Richardsonia haenkeana, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and narrow, strap-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters at the base of the stem. It is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
